Authors: Kusumajati D.A., Chairiyani R.P., Martoredjo N.T.
Title: The Influence of Social Media on Human Behavior in Adolescents (Case Study of Bina Nusantara University Students)
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusumajati, D.A., Character Building Development Center, Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Chairiyani, R.P., Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Martoredjo, N.T., Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The use of social media at this time cannot be separated from the needs of the community, in this case, they are teenagers. The use of social networks by students generates positive and negative behavioral changes. This study measures the effect of social networks on the behavior of human values in adolescents. The research subjects were active students studying at Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta. The purpose of this study was to determine the effect of social media on human behavior in adolescents.This research uses non-experimental quantitative methods. Data obtained from social media and human behavior measurement tools and have been tested on 473 students. The population in this study were active students at Bina Nusantara University. The results showed that there was an influence between social media and human behavior in social aspects and diversity. This means that the higher the use of social media by students increases the influence in social activities together with other people from various aspects of the background. © 2020 ACM.
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Big data; Social aspects; Social networking (online); Students; Behavioral changes; Human behaviors; Human values; Quantitative method; Research subjects; Social activities; Social media; University students; Economic and social effects

Authors: Kusumajati D.A., Ruman Y.S., Oktriono K.
Title: The influence of lecturers' competencies towards students' performance motivation: A case study at higher education
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Symposium on Educational Technology, ISET 2017
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Information System, Indonesia; Communication Studies Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Language Center, Tourism Destination Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusumajati, D.A., Character Building Development Center, Information System, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Communication Studies Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Language Center, Tourism Destination Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: The research aims to examine the influence of lecturers' competences towards student achievement motivation. By knowing the relationship lectures' competencies and performance motivation, researchers intend to provide feedback for Bina Nusantara University towards the development of lecturers' competencies and motivation. The competencies of the lecturers are the external factors that bolster students' motivation to perform appropriately. The research was quantitative-based approach and engaging 30 respondents of Bina Nusantara University students. The results showed that the influence of lecturers' competency towards students' performance motivation counted for 34.4%. It signified that 65.6% contribution is based on other factors. Lecturers' competencies, that predisposed high impact towards students' performance motivation, comprised of social, pedagogic, and personality competencies. The subsequent studies are recommended to be explored in depth. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Bins; Education; Educational technology; Motivation; Teaching; Achievement; Competencies; External factors; High impact; Higher education; Lecturers; Student achievement; University students; Students

Authors: Kusumajati D.A., Ruman Y.S., Anwar R., Oktriono K.
Title: The perception of cultural value towards college students: A case study in higher education
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 10th International Conference on Human System Interactions, HSI 2017
Affiliations: Information System Department, Character Building Development Center, United States; Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, United States; Language Center, Tourism Destination Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusumajati, D.A., Information System Department, Character Building Development Center, United States; Ruman, Y.S., Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, United States; Anwar, R., Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, United States; Oktriono, K., Language Center, Tourism Destination Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: The study aims to measure Bina Nusantara University students? perception towards cultural value. Dimensions of gauged cultural value consisted of five indicators, namely power distance, uncertainty avoidance, individualism vs. collectivity, masculinity vs. femininity, and long-term orientation vs. short-term orientation. The study oriented to provide input for the organization upon the perception of students? cultural value. Cultural values are the guidelines of organized community life and influence human behavior toward the environment. This study was conducted on 95 students of Bina Nusantara University. The results indicated that students embraced an auspicious understanding of cultural values. Based on the research, it uncovered that students retained a quite high understanding of cultural values on the dimensions of individualism vs. collectivism and masculinity vs. femininity. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Bins; Sensory perception; College; College students; Cultural value; Higher education; Human behaviors; Long-term orientation; Uncertainty avoidance; University students; Students
Funding Text 1: The study was supported by Bina Nusantara University.

Authors: Ruman Y.S., Kusumajati D.A., Gea A.A.
Title: Effect of learning interest against learning motivation on character building courses at Binus University Jakarta
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Binus University, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Kemanggisan–Palmerah, West Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ruman, Y.S., Character Building Development Center, Binus University, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Kemanggisan–Palmerah, West Jakarta, Indonesia; Kusumajati, D.A., Character Building Development Center, Binus University, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Kemanggisan–Palmerah, West Jakarta, Indonesia; Gea, A.A., Character Building Development Center, Binus University, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Kemanggisan–Palmerah, West Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Student learning achievement can be determined by student factors, teaching factors, and educational systems as whole. The concern of this research is based on student factors, especially the motivation of students to learn. There are many factors to motivate students to learn and one of them is learning interest. This research proposes to describe the contribution of learning interests against the learning motivation. To describe this contribution, this research chooses Character Building Course at Binus University as a study case. All students at Binus University have to take Character Building class. This research described how student’s interest correlated with the motivation of the students in learning Character Building. Based on the quantitative method, this research concluded that there is a correlation between a student’s interest and the student’s motivation in learning Character Building Course. The contribution of the student’s interest against the student’s motivation in learning Character Building is 9.7%. Because of the correlation is very weak, this research recommended to undergo advancing research that based on multiple variable both internal and external motivation, either on student’s level, lecturer, learning facility, teaching learning activities or learning system as whole. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers.
